article.title: Israeli strikes hit Gaza, at least 230 killed

pipeline.tool: Entity Merging - Co-reference and Anaphora Resolution

sentence.plainText: Israeli strikes hit Gaza, at least 230 killed
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (JJ Israeli) (NNS strikes)) (VP (VBD hit) (NP (NP (NNP Gaza)) (, ,) (NP (NP (QP (IN at) (JJS least) (CD 230))) (VP (VBN killed)))))))

sentence.plainText: GAZA CITY, Gaza Strip (AP) -- Israeli warplanes sent more than 100 tons of bombs crashing down on key security installations in Hamas-ruled Gaza on Saturday, killing more than 200 Palestinians at the launch of an open-ended campaign mean to stop rocket and mortar attacks that have traumatized southern Israel.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (NP (NNP GAZA) (NNP CITY)) (, ,) (NP (NNP Gaza) (NNP Strip) (NNP () (NNP AP) (NNP ))) (PRN (: --) (S (NP (JJ Israeli) (NNS warplanes)) (VP (VBD sent) (NP (NP (QP (JJR more) (IN than) (CD 100)) (NNS tons)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NNS bombs)) (VP (VBG crashing) (PRT (RP down)) (PP (IN on) (NP (NP (JJ key) (NN security) (NNS installations)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (NNP Hamas-ruled) (NNP Gaza)) (PP (IN on) (NP (NNP Saturday))))))) (, ,) (S (VP (VBG killing) (NP (QP (JJR more) (IN than) (CD 200)) (NNPS Palestinians)) (PP (IN at) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN launch)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT an) (JJ open-ended) (NN campaign))))))))))))))) (VP (VBP mean) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB stop) (NP (NP (NN rocket) (CC and) (NN mortar) (NNS attacks)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBP have) (VP (VBD traumatized) (NP (JJ southern) (NNP Israel))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: At least 230 Palestinians, most of them militants, died and more than 400 were wounded in one of the bloodiest days in decades of Israeli-Palestinian fighting.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NP (QP (IN At) (JJS least) (CD 230)) (NNPS Palestinians)) (, ,) (NP (NP (JJS most)) (PP (IN of) (NP (PRP them) (NNS militants)))) (, ,)) (VP (VBD died))) (CC and) (S (NP (QP (JJR more) (IN than) (CD 400))) (VP (VBD were) (VP (VBN wounded) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (CD one)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ bloodiest) (NNS days)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (NNS decades)) (PP (IN of) (NP (JJ Israeli-Palestinian) (NN fighting)))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: One Israeli was also killed, and six Israelis were wounded.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NNP One) (NNP Israeli)) (VP (VBD was) (VP (ADVP (RB also)) (VBN killed)))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (CD six) (NNPS Israelis)) (VP (VBD were) (VP (VBN wounded)))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: The unprecedented assault sparked protests and condemnations throughout the Arab world, and many of Israel's Western allies urged restraint, though the U.S. blamed Hamas for the fighting.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (DT The) (JJ unprecedented) (NN assault)) (VP (VBD sparked) (NP (NNS protests) (CC and) (NNS condemnations)) (PP (IN throughout) (NP (DT the) (JJ Arab) (NN world))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NP (JJ many)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (NNP Israel) (POS 's)) (JJ Western) (NNS allies)))) (VP (VBD urged) (NP (NN restraint)) (, ,) (SBAR (IN though) (S (NP (DT the) (NNP U.S.)) (VP (VBD blamed) (NP (NP (NNP Hamas)) (PP (IN for) (NP (DT the) (NN fighting))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: But there was no end in sight.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (CC But) (NP (EX there)) (VP (VBD was) (NP (NP (DT no) (NN end)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NN sight))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Israel obliquely threatened to go after Hamas' leaders, and militants kept pelting Israel with rockets.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NNP Israel)) (ADVP (RB obliquely)) (VP (VBD threatened) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB go) (PP (IN after) (NP (NP (NNP Hamas) (POS ')) (NNS leaders)))))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NNS militants)) (VP (VBD kept) (S (VP (VBG pelting) (NP (NP (NNP Israel)) (PP (IN with) (NP (NNS rockets)))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Hundreds of Israeli infantry and armored corps troops headed for the Gaza border in preparation for a possible ground invasion, military officials said, speaking on condition of anonymity under army guidelines.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NP (NNS Hundreds)) (PP (IN of) (NP (JJ Israeli) (NN infantry) (CC and) (JJ armored) (NN corps) (NNS troops)))) (VP (VBD headed) (PP (IN for) (NP (DT the) (NNP Gaza) (NN border))) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (NN preparation)) (PP (IN for) (NP (DT a) (JJ possible) (NN ground) (NN invasion))))))) (, ,) (NP (JJ military) (NNS officials)) (VP (VBD said) (, ,) (S (VP (VBG speaking) (PP (IN on) (NP (NP (NN condition)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN anonymity))))) (PP (IN under) (NP (NN army) (NNS guidelines)))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: In a televised statement Saturday evening, Prime Minister Ehud Olmert said the goal was "to bring about a fundamental improvement in the security situation of the residents of the southern part of the country."
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (PP (IN In) (NP (DT a) (JJ televised) (NN statement))) (NP (NNP Saturday) (NN evening)) (, ,) (NP (NNP Prime) (NNP Minister) (NNP Ehud) (NNP Olmert)) (VP (VBD said) (SBAR (S (NP (DT the) (NN goal)) (VP (VBD was) (ADJP (JJ ") (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB bring) (PP (IN about) (NP (NP (DT a) (JJ fundamental) (NN improvement)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN security) (NN situation)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (DT the) (NNS residents)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ southern) (NN part)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT the) (NN country))))))))))))))))))) (. .) ('' ")))

sentence.plainText: He added, "It could take some time."
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (PRP He)) (VP (VBD added) (, ,) (`` ") (S (NP (PRP It)) (VP (MD could) (VP (VB take) (NP (DT some) (NN time)))))) (. .) ('' ")))

sentence.plainText: The Israeli airstrikes caused widespread panic and confusion, and black plumes of smoke billowed above the territory, ruled by the Islamic militant Hamas for the past 18 months.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (DT The) (JJ Israeli) (NNS airstrikes)) (VP (VBD caused) (NP (JJ widespread) (NN panic) (CC and) (NN confusion)))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NP (JJ black) (NNS plumes)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN smoke)))) (VP (VBD billowed) (PP (IN above) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN territory)) (, ,) (VP (VBN ruled) (PP (IN by) (NP (NP (DT the) (JJ Islamic) (JJ militant) (NN Hamas)) (PP (IN for) (NP (DT the) (JJ past) (CD 18) (NNS months)))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Some of the Israeli missiles struck in densely populated areas as students were leaving school, and women rushed into the streets frantically looking for their children.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NP (DT Some)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT the) (JJ Israeli) (NNS missiles)))) (VP (VBD struck) (PP (IN in) (NP (ADJP (RB densely) (VBN populated)) (NNS areas))) (SBAR (IN as) (S (NP (NNS students)) (VP (VBD were) (VP (VBG leaving) (NP (NN school)))))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NNS women)) (VP (VBD rushed) (PP (IN into) (S (NP (DT the) (NNS streets)) (ADVP (RB frantically)) (VP (VBG looking) (PP (IN for) (NP (PRP$ their) (NNS children)))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: At least 15 civilians were killed, officials said.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (QP (IN At) (JJS least) (CD 15)) (NNS civilians)) (VP (VBD were) (VP (VBN killed)))) (, ,) (NP (NNS officials)) (VP (VBD said)) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: "My son is gone, my son is gone," wailed Said Masri, a 57-year-old shopkeeper, as he sat in the middle of a Gaza City street, slapping his face and covering his head with dust from a bombed-out security compound nearby.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (SINV (`` ") (S (S (NP (PRP$ My) (NN son)) (VP (VBZ is) (VP (VBN gone)))) (, ,) (S (NP (PRP$ my) (NN son)) (VP (VBZ is) (VP (VBN gone))))) (, ,) ('' ") (VP (VBD wailed)) (NP (NP (NNP Said) (NNP Masri)) (, ,) (NP (NP (DT a) (JJ 57-year-old) (NN shopkeeper)) (, ,) (SBAR (IN as) (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD sat) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN middle)) (PP (IN of) (NP (DT a) (NNP Gaza) (NNP City) (NN street))))) (, ,) (S (VP (VP (VBG slapping) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN face))) (CC and) (VP (VBG covering) (NP (PRP$ his) (NN head)) (PP (IN with) (NP (NP (NN dust)) (PP (IN from) (NP (DT a) (JJ bombed-out) (NN security) (NN compound))))) (ADVP (RB nearby)))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: He said he had sent his 9-year-old son out to purchase cigarettes minutes before the airstrikes began and could not find him.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (PRP He)) (VP (VBD said) (SBAR (S (NP (PRP he)) (VP (VBD had) (VP (VBN sent) (NP (PRP$ his) (JJ 9-year-old) (NN son) (PRT (RP out))) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB purchase) (NP (NNS cigarettes) (NNS minutes)) (SBAR (IN before) (S (NP (DT the) (NNS airstrikes)) (VP (VP (VBD began)) (CC and) (VP (MD could) (RB not) (VP (VB find) (NP (PRP him))))))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: "May I burn like the cigarettes, may Israel burn," Masri moaned.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (`` ") (S (NP (NNP May)) (PRN (S (NP (PRP I)) (VP (VBP burn) (PP (IN like) (NP (DT the) (NNS cigarettes))))) (, ,)) (VP (MD may) (ADVP (RB Israel)) (VP (VB burn)))) (, ,) ('' ") (NP (NNP Masri)) (VP (VBD moaned)) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Militants often operate against Israel from civilian areas, and that has led to steep civilian casualties in the past when Israel has retaliated.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NNS Militants)) (ADVP (RB often)) (VP (VBP operate) (PP (IN against) (NP (NNP Israel))) (PP (IN from) (NP (JJ civilian) (NNS areas))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (DT that)) (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN led) (PP (TO to) (NP (NP (JJ steep) (JJ civilian) (NNS casualties)) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT the) (NN past))))) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB when)) (S (NP (NNP Israel)) (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN retaliated)))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Late Saturday, thousands of Gazans received Arabic-language voice mails on their cellphones from the Israeli military, urging them to leave homes where militants might have stashed weapons.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (RB Late) (NNP Saturday)) (, ,) (NP (NP (NNS thousands)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Gazans)))) (VP (VBD received) (NP (JJ Arabic-language) (NN voice) (NNS mails)) (PP (IN on) (NP (PRP$ their) (NNS cellphones))) (PP (IN from) (NP (DT the) (JJ Israeli) (NN military))) (, ,) (S (VP (VBG urging) (S (NP (PRP them)) (VP (TO to) (VP (VB leave) (NP (NNS homes)) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB where)) (S (NP (NNS militants)) (VP (MD might) (VP (VB have) (VP (VBD stashed) (NP (NNS weapons))))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: The offensive began eight days after a six-month truce between Israel and the militants expired.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (DT The) (NN offensive)) (VP (VBD began) (NP (CD eight) (NNS days)) (PP (IN after) (NP (DT a) (JJ six-month) (NN truce))) (PP (IN between) (NP (NNP Israel))))) (CC and) (S (NP (DT the) (NNS militants)) (VP (VBD expired))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: The Israeli army says Palestinian militants have fired some 300 rockets and mortars at Israeli targets over the past week, and 10 times that number over the past year.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (DT The) (JJ Israeli) (NN army)) (VP (VBZ says) (SBAR (S (NP (JJ Palestinian) (NNS militants)) (VP (VBP have) (VP (VBN fired) (NP (QP (DT some) (CD 300)) (NNS rockets) (CC and) (NNS mortars)) (PP (IN at) (NP (NP (NP (JJ Israeli) (NNS targets)) (PP (IN over) (NP (DT the) (JJ past) (NN week)))) (, ,) (CC and) (NP (NP (QP (CD 10) (NNS times)) (DT that) (NN number)) (PP (IN over) (NP (DT the) (JJ past) (NN year))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: "There is a time for calm and there is a time for fighting, and now is the time for fighting," said Israeli Defense Minister Ehud Barak, vowing to expand the operation if necessary.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (SINV (`` ") (S (S (NP (EX There)) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN time)) (PP (IN for) (NP (NN calm)))))) (CC and) (S (NP (EX there)) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (NP (DT a) (NN time)) (PP (IN for) (S (VP (VBG fighting))))))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (RB now)) (VP (VBZ is) (NP (NP (DT the) (NN time)) (PP (IN for) (S (VP (VBG fighting)))))))) (, ,) ('' ") (VP (VBD said)) (NP (NNP Israeli) (NNP Defense) (NNP Minister) (NNP Ehud) (NNP Barak)) (, ,) (S (VP (VBG vowing) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB expand) (NP (DT the) (NN operation)) (SBAR (IN if) (FRAG (ADJP (JJ necessary))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: In Gaza City's main security compound, bodies of more than a dozen uniformed Hamas police lay on the ground.

sentence.plainText: Civilians rushed wounded people in cars and vans to hospitals because there weren't enough ambulances to transport all the dead and wounded.

sentence.plainText: "There are heads without bodies .... There's blood in the corridors.

sentence.plainText: People are weeping, women are crying, doctors are shouting, " said nurse Ahmed Abdel Salaam from Shifa Hospital, Gaza's main treatment center.

sentence.plainText: Military officials said aircraft released more than 100 tons of bombs in the first nine hours of fighting, focusing initially on militant training camps, rocket-manufacturing facilities and weapons warehouses that had been identified in advance.

sentence.plainText: A second wave was directed at squads who fired about 80 rockets and mortars at Israeli border communities.

sentence.plainText: The campaign was launched six weeks before national elections.

sentence.plainText: Gaza's political leaders, who have been targeted in the past, went into hiding earlier this week.

sentence.plainText: "We are stronger, and more determined, and have more will, and we will hold onto our rights even more than before," Haniyeh said.

sentence.plainText: "This is the time for a third uprising," he said.

sentence.plainText: Israel withdrew its troops and settlers in 2005 after crushing the second Palestinian uprising, but it has maintained control over the territory's border crossings.

sentence.plainText: Netivot only recently become a target, and dozens of stunned residents, some weeping, gathered at the house that took the deadly rocket hit.

sentence.plainText: A hole gaped in one of the walls, which was pocked with shrapnel marks.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (DT A) (NN hole)) (VP (VBN gaped) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (CD one)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NP (DT the) (NNS walls)) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT which)) (S (VP (VBD was) (VP (VBN pocked) (PP (IN with) (NP (JJ shrapnel) (NNS marks)))))))))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: "We need to finish this once and for all and strike back hard," said next-door neighbor Avraham Chen-Chatam, 57.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (SINV (`` ") (S (NP (PRP We)) (VP (VBP need) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VP (VB finish) (NP (DT this)) (UCP (ADVP (RB once)) (CC and) (PP (IN for) (NP (DT all))))) (CC and) (VP (VB strike) (ADVP (RB back) (RB hard)))))))) (, ,) ('' ") (VP (VBD said) (NP (JJ next-door) (NN neighbor))) (NP (NP (NNP Avraham) (NNP Chen-Chatam)) (, ,) (NP (CD 57))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Streets were nearly empty in Sderot, the Israeli border town pummeled hardest by rockets.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NNPS Streets)) (VP (VBD were) (ADJP (RB nearly) (JJ empty)) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP Sderot))))) (, ,) (NP (DT the) (JJ Israeli) (NN border) (NN town)) (VP (VBD pummeled) (ADVP (RBS hardest)) (PP (IN by) (NP (NNS rockets)))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: But dozens of people congregated on a hilltop to watch the Israeli aerial attacks.

sentence.plainText: The TV images of dead and wounded Gazans inflamed Arab public opinion, and protests erupted in Arab Israeli villages, the West Bank and elsewhere in the Arab world.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NP (DT The) (NN TV) (NNS images)) (PP (IN of) (NP (JJ dead) (CC and) (JJ wounded) (NNS Gazans)))) (VP (VBD inflamed) (NP (JJ Arab) (JJ public) (NN opinion)))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NNS protests)) (VP (VBD erupted) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (JJ Arab) (JJ Israeli) (NNS villages)) (, ,) (NP (DT the) (NNP West) (NNP Bank)) (CC and) (NP (RB elsewhere)))) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT the) (JJ Arab) (NN world))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: The campaign embarrassed moderate Arab regimes that have encouraged Israeli-Palestinian peacemaking and weakened Hamas' rival, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas, who has ruled only the West Bank since Hamas violently seized control of Gaza in June 2007.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (NP (NP (DT The) (NN campaign)) (VP (VBN embarrassed) (NP (NP (JJ moderate) (JJ Arab) (NNS regimes)) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (VP (VBP have) (VP (VP (VBN encouraged) (NP (JJ Israeli-Palestinian) (NN peacemaking))) (CC and) (VP (VBN weakened) (NP (NP (NP (NNP Hamas) (POS ')) (NN rival)) (, ,) (NP (JJ Palestinian) (NNP President) (NNP Mahmoud) (NNPS Abbas)) (, ,) (SBAR (WHNP (WP who)) (S (VP (VBZ has) (VP (VBN ruled) (NP (NP (RB only) (DT the) (NNP West) (NNP Bank)) (PP (IN since) (NP (NNP Hamas))))))))))))))))) (ADVP (RB violently)) (VP (VBD seized) (NP (NP (NN control)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NNP Gaza)))) (PP (IN in) (NP (NNP June) (CD 2007)))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: Abbas condemned the attacks, but fearing violence could spiral out of control, his forces also broke up protests in the West Bank.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (NNS Abbas)) (VP (VBD condemned) (NP (DT the) (NNS attacks)))) (, ,) (CC but) (S (S (VP (VBG fearing) (SBAR (S (NP (NN violence)) (VP (MD could) (VP (VB spiral) (PRT (RP out)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN control))))))))) (, ,) (NP (PRP$ his) (NNS forces)) (VP (ADVP (RB also)) (VBD broke) (PRT (RP up)) (NP (NP (NNS protests)) (PP (IN in) (NP (DT the) (NNP West) (NNP Bank)))))) (. .)))

sentence.plainText: The offensive also risked opening new fronts, including unrest that could destabilize the West Bank and ignite possible rocket attacks by Lebanese Hezbollah guerrillas on northern Israel.

sentence.plainText: Britain, the EU, the Vatican, the U.N. secretary-general and special Mideast envoy Tony Blair all called for an immediate restoration of calm.

sentence.plainText: But the U.S., Israel's closest ally, blamed Hamas.

sentence.plainText: "These people are nothing but thugs, so Israel is going to defend its people against terrorists like Hamas that indiscriminately kill their own people," White House spokesman Gordon Johndroe said.
sentence.constituencyParse: (ROOT (S (`` ") (S (S (NP (DT These) (NNS people)) (VP (VP (VBP are) (ADJP (NN nothing))) (CC but) (VP (VBZ thugs)))) (, ,) (IN so) (S (NP (NNP Israel)) (VP (VBZ is) (VP (VBG going) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB defend) (NP (PRP$ its) (NNS people)) (PP (IN against) (NP (NP (NNS terrorists)) (PP (IN like) (NP (NNP Hamas))) (SBAR (WHNP (WDT that)) (S (ADVP (RB indiscriminately)) (VP (VBP kill) (NP (PRP$ their) (JJ own) (NNS people)))))))))))))) (, ,) ('' ") (NP (NNP White) (NNP House) (NN spokesman) (NNP Gordon) (NNP Johndroe)) (VP (VBD said)) (. .)))
